item.title: Aarakocra
item.description: Feathered and Flighted ![[Aarakocra 2.png]] Description The [[Aarakocra]] are a colorful and expressive people. Known for their communal nature, expressive dialect, and body language.

item.title: Aasimar
item.description: God Blooded ![[Aasimar.png]] Description Beings born with celestial blood. Academics, historians, and churches all disagree about the exact nature of [[Aasimar]], and some do not even believe that they truly exist.

item.title: Abaddon
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Courage ![[Abbadon.png]] The one armed warrior god. The angel of rebellion. [[Abaddon]], known as Crackle in the Aarakocran Tongue, bears the moral of Courage.

item.title: Abdjadan
item.description: The underwater city of Triton ![[Abdjadan skyline.png]] For millennia, [[Abdjadan]] sat quiet and hidden beneath the waves of [[The Archsea]]. The surrounding kingdoms were oblivious to its existence.

item.title: Absurdia
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Arguably the weirdest place in all of [[Zol]]. Many believe it is not even a real place, other’s think it is the manifestation of some strange magic, or the will of a mischievous god.

item.title: Adrathar
item.description: See [[Adrathar, Father of the Wind]].

item.title: Adrathar, Father of the Wind
item.description: Wayward God of Storms, Major Deity ![[adrathar storm.png]] He who weaves the wind, demands of the rain, and commands the lightning.

item.title: Agon and Ra'Queen
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Oaths ![[Agon and Raqueen.png]] A being of two sides. [[Agon and Ra’Queen]] are one and the same.

item.title: Airships
item.description: Wonderous [[Apparatum]] constructed using surprisingly simple [[Iron Light]] principals. Many different types of [[Airships]] have been developed, using many different methods of flight.

item.title: Alchemy
item.description: Alchemy is a subsection of the [[Artificers]] practice. It involves the deconstruction and combination of substances in a scientific processes to create products that are greater than the sum of their parts.

item.title: Aldem, King of all Hells
item.description: Void God of Hell, Major Deity ![[Aldem king of all hells.png]] Lord of [[Fiends]], Conqueror of [[Damnation]]. [[Aldem, King of all Hells]] has domain over each and every layer of hell that exists in [[Zol]].

item.title: Alderian Council
item.description: The [[Alderian Council]] is the governing body of [[The Free Cities of Alderun]]. Within their own city, they have the authority similar to that of a foreign city lord.

item.title: Alderian Laws
item.description: This set of laws contains many of the main crimes that one could commit within [[The Free Cities of Alderun]].

item.title: Alderian Rebellion
item.description: The breaking of chains, and the founding of [[The Free Cities of Alderun]] After the peak of the [[Triumvirate Battles]], [[Kapesh]] was left weak from the war with [[The Maul Bearer]] and his army.

item.title: Alderian Seat
item.description: See [[Alderian Council]]

item.title: Anticities
item.description: [[Anticities]] are type of settlement defined by academics. It is a term rarely used by ordinary society. It defines itself as a city or smaller settlement not bound by the standard infrastructure and laws seen within the kingdoms.

item.title: Antidescence
item.description: The act of using [[Viridescence]] in its destructive form. It involves stealing the power from nature, rather than borrowing it. This act damages, and even kills the things it draws from.

item.title: Antiverdants
item.description: Those who use [[Antidescence]]

item.title: Apolyatum
item.description: See [[Damnation]]

item.title: Apparatum
item.description: A word for devices made by [[Iron Light]]. These devices can be quite simple or very complex. Their value scales with complexity, and distance from locations where their production is common place (ex: [[Deepspell]]).

item.title: Arcanists
item.description: [[Caster]]s who utilize the will of [[Arcana]].

item.title: Arcanum
item.description: One third of [[The University]]. A branch of academia with a focus on the will of [[Arcana]], and its relation to the world.

item.title: Archaisms
item.description: See [[The Grand Nothing]]

item.title: Archon
item.description: The name for a ruler within [[The Ward]].

item.title: Arkian
item.description: In life we are impure, but in The Watcher’s gaze we are seen anew. ![[Arkian.png]] Overview [[Arkian]] is a Zolaen-Centric denomination of religion within [[The Three Corners of Civilization]].

item.title: Artificers
item.description: Magical crafters who bend the fundamental powers of [[Zol]] into their own creations. The creations can take many forms but largely fall into the four categories of Engineering, [[Alchemy]], [[Iron Light]], and [[Imbuement Perpetuum]].

item.title: Ashian
item.description: In his hands he held the gift of three fires. Each with the power to raze the Void, and ignite the world anew !

item.title: Attunement
item.description: [[Attunement]] is the process by which an individual is able to use a magical object. This may be [[Apparatum]] or some more powerful [[Imbuement Perpetuum]].

item.title: Automail
item.description: Automail is a unique form of [[Apparatum]] that is used to replace or enhance portions of an individual’s body. They utilize the [[Ferric Alphabet]] symbols for mind, blood and bone in complex arrays to accomplish the complex, fine-motor controls required for enhancing or replacing things like arms or legs.

item.title: Ayamot
item.description: Zolaen God of Justice, Major Deity ![[Ayamot.png]] The Golden Dragon of Justice, father of the metallic dragons. Ayamot is the holy judge of the [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: Beast Ire
item.description: Fear the Blood of Beasts A well intentioned gift from a god turned into a living nightmare. ![[Beast Ire.png]] During the [[First Age]], [[Kerndall]], the king of beasts, sought to give the people of [[Zol]] the strength and instincts of beasts.

item.title: Beastfolk
item.description: The descendants of those untempted by the [[Beast Ire]] ![[Beastfolk.png]] Description The [[Beast Ire]] plague began as boons of power from [[Kerndall]].

item.title: Beastmen
item.description: See [[Beast Ire]]

item.title: Bethar
item.description: Wayward God of Craft, Minor Deity ![[Bethar.png]] The god of mortal creation and artistry. Bethar is a quiet but important god to [[Zol]].

item.title: Bloodhunters
item.description: See [[Beast Ire]]

item.title: Brass Taldora
item.description: See [[Ryze]] or [[The Brass Hall]]

item.title: Cadence
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Adaptability ![[Cadence 2.png]] He who is known by Manu Modica, Clausula, Cade, Ence, and Mao Leve. Known by many names and many forms, [[Cadence]] is the Wandering God of Adaptability.

item.title: Calendar
item.description: A calendar year in [[Zol]] is defined by 4 seasons, each 100 days long, with days being 24 hours. Weeks are divided into 10 days:

item.title: Campaigns
item.description: This page serves as an Index for my TTRPG campaigns containing material relevant to the players of the given campaigns.

item.title: Chalkstone
item.description: A unique white stone found only in a few places all over [[Zol]], most abundantly near [[Holocene]]. No one knows the geological process that creates it, however it is extremely useful.

item.title: Changelings
item.description: The people of [[The Oldshards]] ![[Changeling.png]] Description [[Changelings]] are a very unique race of people. This uniqueness has brought them many gifts, but equally as many challenges.

item.title: Chorn
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Patience ![[Chorn.png]] All things that have occurred, and will occur are the products of seeds sewn in time.

item.title: Chromatic Dragons
item.description: See [[Dragons]]

item.title: Church of The Hum
item.description: See [[Holyfield]]

item.title: Church of Three Fires
item.description: The [[Ashian]] church. The dominant, Trinity-Centric religion of [[Kapesh]]. It is headquartered within [[Stigmata]], and is lead by [[The Word of Fire]].

item.title: Cities
item.description: This page acts as an index for all cities within the world. For more details on their exact locations, and how they relate to their kingdoms, it is encourage that you read through the Regions.

item.title: Clerics
item.description: A name commonly used for those who use the power of [[Observance]] through one of the good-willed [[Gods]].

item.title: D'Nairae
item.description: [[D’Nairae]] are a unique symbol within the city of [[Ka’thoor]]. These symbols manifest as simple painted earrings. Each color represents a favor the bearer wishes to give freely to those in need.

item.title: Daetro
item.description: Wayward God of Fire, Minor Deity ![[Daetro.png]] Lord of the flame, [[Daetro]] is the spirit of fire and the molten expanses that exist in [[Zol]].

item.title: Damnation
item.description: The culmination of thousands of hells. All created to seek the destruction of [[Goh’zul]], now formed as one unified force of destruction.

item.title: Demodemacht
item.description: ![[Demodemacht.png]] The grandest mountain range in [[The Three Corners]]. [[Demodemacht]]’s perilous peaks are the largest in all the realm. Their grandeur is the setting for many-a-tale in the eastern culture.

item.title: Demons
item.description: The unknown horrors of [[The Void]]. A poorly understood cast of monsters and evil beings. They are the descendants, acolytes, or the very beings who defied [[The Watcher in The Door]] when he spun The [[Sea of Monsters]] into [[Zol]].

item.title: Diddan
item.description: The Lawless Gun-Slinging Sand Dunes ![[Diddan Skyline.png]] Far from the comforts of the east, [[Diddan]] is a rough and tumble city of sandy streets and gruff gunslingers.

item.title: Dislimn
item.description: see the [[Fell]]

item.title: Dorian
item.description: Beauty can only be seen within The Watcher’s Vision ![[Dorian.png]] Overview [[Dorian]] is a Zolaen-Centric denomination of religion within [[The Three Corners of Civilization]].

item.title: Draedon, the Ascended Wizard
item.description: Wayward God of The Arcane Arts, Minor Deity ![[Draedon.png]] The uncontested, He who has unraveled the secrets of [[Arcana]]. Draedon is arguably not a god, but is as powerful as many minor deities.

item.title: Dragonborn
item.description: Those of dragon kin ![[Dragonborn.png]] Description A cast of dragon-blooded people. The exact nature of their existence is not known, but those who subscribe to the theory of [[The Triumvirate]] believe they are the result of ancient humans who tampered with the power of dragons.

item.title: Dragons
item.description: The strange and magical species of sapient monsters who posses a history and culture of their own ![[dragons.png]] [[Dragons]] are immensely complex and powerful creatures.

item.title: Dragonstalkers
item.description: See [[Hoss]]

item.title: Drow
item.description: See [[Elves]]

item.title: Druids
item.description: Those who use [[Magic]] through [[Viridescence]]

item.title: Dwarves
item.description: The Mountain Folk, thought to be favored by the Gods ![[Dwarf.png]] Description Proud, strong, and resilient. [[Dwarves]] are a people of steel and stone.

item.title: Eladrin
item.description: The Fae-Touched Elves ![[Eladrin.png]] Description [[Eladrin]] appear very similarly to [[High Elves]], but bear slightly differing physiology. [[Eladrin]] are the product of [[Elves]] who ventured into the [[Fey]] not long after [[The Awakening]].

item.title: Ellyon and Aradon
item.description: Wayward Gods of Seafaring and Skyfaring, Minor Deities ![[Ellyon and Aradon.png]] The offspring of [[Ohlit]]. Ellyon the daughter of sea and Aradon the son of sky.

item.title: Elm Manor
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence The cosmic estate of the greatest wizard to ever live, [[Draedon, the Ascended Wizard]].

item.title: Elves
item.description: Within [[Zol]] there a multiple types of [[Elves]]. [[High Elves]], [[Wood Elves]], and [[Drow]]. Each is physiologically similar, with a few minor differences.

item.title: Elysium Station
item.description: The Gateway to the Sky ![[Station Skyline.png]] The sister city to the floating capital of [[Heliodor]]. Geographically within [[Eucaren]], but considered under the jurisdiction of [[Heliodor]], Elysium station was originally constructed with the express purpose of acting as a commerce and transportation hub for the capital.

item.title: Enchantment
item.description: A term often used to describe the utilization [[Imbuement Perpetuum]] or [[Iron Light]]

item.title: Ep Drukar
item.description: The Elemental City ![[Ep Drukar skyline 3.png]] [[Ep Drukar]] is home to the [[Genasi]]. A race of beings who are born with a unique connection to [[The Elemental Planes]].

item.title: Eptro
item.description: Wayward God of Ice, Minor Deity ![[Eptro.png]] Lord of the frost, Eptro is the spirit of ice and the frozen expanses that exist in [[Zol]].

item.title: Estates
item.description: [[Estates]] are a type of settlement which exists outside of a City. They are similar to [[Gate Towns]] and [[Outer Villages]] in this sense alone.

item.title: Fairies
item.description: Children of the Fey and Fell ![[Fairy.png]] Description There are many different types of [[Fairies]]. All of differing sizes, disposition, and magical influence.

item.title: Fey
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Also known as The Fae, Feywilds, or Faerûn. The [[Fey]] is an echo of the [[Prime Material Plane]], that manifests almost like a dream-like version of the normal world.

item.title: Fiends
item.description: [[Fiends]], sometimes called Devils, are the acolytes of [[Aldem, King of all Hells]]. There are an evil cast of heinous creatures.

item.title: Firbolgs
item.description: Peaceful and Brave ![[Firbolg.png]] Description [[Firbolgs]] are known to be generally agreeable people. They have a reputation of leading slow, peaceful lives.

item.title: First Age
item.description: See [[Historical Timeline]].

item.title: Flatkey
item.description: A flat key is a medallion given to the workers of [[Heliodor]] who reside in the city of [[Elysium Station]]. This allows them passage to and from the city every day.

item.title: Flaunt
item.description: Flaunt is a sport played only within [[Reach Run]]. It involves 2 teams of 8 trying to knock each other off of rafts suspended high above water.

item.title: Form Art
item.description: The performance art of [[Changelings]] that involves altering ones body in an artistic display.

item.title: Galliard Crown
item.description: See [[King Galliard]].

item.title: Gate Town
item.description: A [[Gate Town]] is a portion of the city that is constructed outside the main wall. [[Zol]] is an extremely dangerous place; bandits, monsters, and war have shaped the nature of cities in very clear ways throughout [[Zol]]’s history.

item.title: Gate Towns
item.description: See [[Gate Town]]

item.title: Genasi
item.description: The people of the Elements ![[Genasi.png]] Description Genasi look quite similar to [[Humans]], but bear distinct colored markings that look like tattoos colored either black, red, white, blue, or green.

item.title: Geographical and Population Scale
item.description: Note from the author: *I personally didn’t like the idea of strictly defining the size of distances or populations within Zol.

item.title: Giants
item.description: Obscure and rare beings of [[Zol]]. There are very few [[Giants]] within the world, but archeologists have discovered evidence of ancient civilizations of the peculiar beings.

item.title: Gilligan's Lift
item.description: The way to the old world Located in [[Tenzentak]], and operated by [[The Bladehammer Guild]]. [[Gilligan’s Lift]] is a great feat of engineering that gives passage from the top of the high cliffs that overlook [[The Grand Nothing]], all the way to the bottom.

item.title: Giriam
item.description: The Deceased Zolaen God of Agriculture, Fertility, Major Deity ![[Giriam.png]] Once seen as the caretaker of mortals. Giriam was the kindest of the [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: Glassian Laws
item.description: The [[Glassian Laws]] are a set of legal rules set in placed based off the needs of society, and [[The Pattern]].

item.title: Gnomes
item.description: Clever and Industrious ![[Gnome.png]] Description Gnomes have a reputation as busy-bodies. Known to have gifted minds and skilled hands that make them great thinkers and craftsmen.

item.title: Goblins
item.description: Clever and Conniving ![[Goblin.png]] Description [[Goblins]] are often associated with very negative things like: incivility, thievery, greed and deception. This prejudice is held by many, and has much evidence to back it up.

item.title: Godkiller
item.description: Who killed a god… and why? ![[the dead warforged with title.png]] The death of [[Giriam]], the Zolaen God of Agriculture and Fertility, has thrown [[Zol]] into an unprecedented era.

item.title: Godkiller - Premise
item.description: The death of [[Giriam]], the Zolaen God of Agriculture and Fertility, has thrown [[Zol]] into an unprecedented era. No one knows exactly what, or who killed this god.

item.title: Godkiller - Weavings
item.description: Throughout the Godkiller story, there are pieces of lore shared in various formats. They are listed here for archival reference.

item.title: Goliaths
item.description: Mighty giants ![[Goliath.png]] Description [[Goliaths]] are the some of the largest of [[Zol]]’s people. Their size and might makes them fearsome warriors.

item.title: Greatwinds
item.description: See [[The Ward]]

item.title: Grung
item.description: Proud and Poisonous ![[Grung.png]] Description [[Grung]] are known to be very proud creatures. They do not like to associate with other [[Races]] as they typically think themselves superior.

item.title: Hags
item.description: A coven of eerie, occult beings of an unknown origin. Based on various piece of collected information, academics widely believe that [[Hags]] are beings who came to [[Zol]] from [[The Cosmos]].

item.title: Half-Elf
item.description: See [[Races]]

item.title: Half-Orc
item.description: See [[Races]]

item.title: Halflings
item.description: Friends to all ![[Halfling.png]] Description [[Halflings]] are known as very friendly, and communal people. They are of short stature and rounded features.

item.title: Harengon
item.description: See [[Harengons]]

item.title: Harengons
item.description: The quick-footed ![[Harengon.png]] Description [[Harengons]] are known to be fast-talking, creative, and communal people. They have very large families with many siblings and cousins.

item.title: High Elves
item.description: see [[Elves]]

item.title: Historical Timeline
item.description: Below is a list of major historical events in chronological order Note: Some events are marked as Razing events. These events involved the destruction and loss of large quantities of historical information (Be it the destruction of archival information, or the loss of great academics).

item.title: House Doucaar
item.description: See [[Kahdinacht]]

item.title: House Tretch
item.description: See [[Kahdinacht]]

item.title: Humans
item.description: The Adaptable, Ambitious, and Assiduous. The bearers of the great sin ![[Human 2.png]] Description Humans are known for their variety, and fervor.

item.title: Hymnal
item.description: See the [[Fey]]

item.title: Illithids
item.description: Parasitic Aliens from [[The Space Outside Reality]] ![[Illithid.png]] Description Also known as Mindflayers, [[Illithids]] are known as powerful and intelligent beings.

item.title: Imperfect Representation
item.description: See [[Iron Light]] and [[Materiation]]

item.title: Iszertion
item.description: The written form of [[The Old Tongue]]. It is an immensely complex form of writing and [[Enchantment]] that only [[Speakers]] can use and understand.

item.title: Jerda'll
item.description: The City of Echoing Caves ![[Jerdall groundline 2.png]] Deep below the forest glades of [[Gethsemane]] lies the tall cavern city of [[Jerda’ll]].

item.title: Jhenbridge
item.description: Built atop the Ruins of Keptifer Academy, filled with ambitious minds and lost things ![[Jhenbridge.png]] Located within [[Audran]], the school is an integral part of [[The University]].

item.title: Kalamdola
item.description: The home mountain of the [[Dwarves]] of [[Gethsemane]]. Located in [[The Peaks of Myth’ira]]. For more information see [[Mod Dranor]].

item.title: Kapeshian Laws
item.description: This set of laws contains many of the main crimes that one could commit within [[Kapesh]]. Law Severity Description Murder High If one kills outside of self defense, or does not have governmental permission.

item.title: Kaszu
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Sagacity ![[Kaszu 2.png]] There is no gift more powerful, wonderful, and dangerous than foresight. [[Kaszu]], also known as Father Time bears the moral of Sagacity.

item.title: Keepships
item.description: [[Keepships]] are unique, magical seafaring vessels of immense size. The carry small cities on their back, and seem to have a consciousness of their own.

item.title: Kenku
item.description: Cursed Corvid ![[Kenku.png]] Description [[Kenku]] are very few in number, and some think they are merely a thing of myth. Every member of their race bears a strange curse which is detectable by [[Divination]].

item.title: Kerketh Academy
item.description: Amongst [[The Free Cities of Alderun]] lies a place of true hope and light. A school where anyone of any creed and learn.

item.title: Kerndall
item.description: See [[Kerndall, the Feral King]].

item.title: Kerndall, the Feral King
item.description: The once god of beasts, fallen from glory into deep madness and a monstrous nature. His disgrace was a result of his wrong doings which caused the [[Beast Ire]] plague.

item.title: Kinadhyne
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Natural Order ![[Kinadhyne.png]] Within the movement of all things lies pattern, purpose, and prophecy. [[Kinadhyne]], also known as The [[Kinadhyne]], or Hercan.

item.title: King Galliard
item.description: The King of [[Kapesh]], one of [[The Three Corners]] two true monarchs ![[King Galliard.png]] Ruler of [[Kapesh]], and crux of [[The Crown Titans]].

item.title: King Tatelak II
item.description: King of [[Laenwalde]], one of [[The Three Corners]] two true monarchs ![[King Tatelak II.png]] Born under the name Byrell Callzen, [[King Tatelak II]] was discovered as a forgotten heir living amongst commoners in [[Woogis]] by academics from [[The University]] who were aiding in the reinstatement of a monarch in [[Laenwalde]].

item.title: Kobolds
item.description: The most clever, and resilient of the lesser dragons ![[Kobold.png]] Description [[Kobolds]] are of short stature, scales, and sharp teeth. Known to keep in packs, [[Kobolds]] are very communal beings, but typically only with other [[Kobolds]].

item.title: Kosskazoka
item.description: The City of Lights ![[Kosskazoka skyline.png]] [[Kosskazoka]] is a city without slumber, known for its large population and fantastically colored [[Apparatum]] lights that leverage the illuminating properties of neon gas.

item.title: Laenwalde Laws
item.description: This set of laws contains many of the main crimes that one could commit within [[Laenwalde]]. Law Severity Description Murder High If one kills outside of self defense, or does not have governmental permission.

item.title: Language
item.description: Language manifests in many unique, and poorly understood ways across [[Zol]]. This is largely because of the effects of [[The Undoing]] and the strange nature of Common.

item.title: Larkleaf
item.description: A rare plants that only grows in the shade of [[The Kodoros]]. It is a potent alchemical ingredient that strengthens the potency of many ingredients, widens error margins, and can be used in place of many different, pesky ingredients.

item.title: Lich
item.description: A person who has used means of powerful [[Necromancy]] to skirt death. They are usually very powerful mages.

item.title: Limbo
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Where the undestined dead are sent to prove themselves to [[The Coilwalker]]. ![[limbo.png]] If [[The Coilwalker]] is not able to determine the fate of a soul in death, they are sent to limbo to undergo a trial.

item.title: Low Automata
item.description: [[Iron Light]] and [[Imbuement Perpetuum]] are capable of creating automata that do not posses a true soul like a [[Warforged]] do.

item.title: Lunite
item.description: Moon Fae ![[Lunite.png]] Description A myth amongst mortals, [[Lunite]] are said to be an ancient magical people who live amongst the civilizations of [[The Prime]].

item.title: Magical Metals
item.description: Within [[Zol]] there are many different naturally occurring materials which can be used across many types of craftsmanship. Some of these are naturally magical metals which are highly sought after.

item.title: Malevolan
item.description: To Know ![[Malevolan.png]] Overview [[Malevolan]] worship is a denomination of religion used to describe any faith that follows a dark entity, typically the [[Void Gods]].

item.title: Materiation
item.description: An affliction caused by long term usage the imperfect implementation of [[Iron Light]]. Causing ones body to slowly degrade to a material state involved in the imperfect runes, causing euphoria and a slow painless death.

item.title: Matter
item.description: See [[Space, Matter, and Energy]]

item.title: Mechanicum Immaculatum
item.description: Pushing the bounds of what it means to be alive, [[Mechanicum Immaculatum]] is the Human translation of Mechanical Conception [[Mechanicum Immaculatum]] is a phenomenon that is responsible for the creation of [[Warforged]].

item.title: Metallic Dragons
item.description: See [[Dragons]]

item.title: Mimics
item.description: [[Mimics]], also called Ayadon’ae by the [[Changelings]] are a species of beings who hail from [[The Glassius Reach]]. The posses the ability to alter their form similarly to [[Changelings]].

item.title: Miscellaneous Topics
item.description: This is an index of various topics which quite relevant to the world, but are either tucked away deep within the pages, or do not have a proper home.

item.title: Mount Zerstel
item.description: The Volcanic Mountain of [[Rockfire]], home to the Fire God [[Daetro]].

item.title: Mythril
item.description: An exceptionally magical metal found only within [[The Peaks of Myth’ira]]. It is a metal held holy in the culture of [[Dwarves]], and is used to produce many magical objects via [[Imbuement Perpetuum]].

item.title: Nothingness
item.description: See [[Space, Matter, and Energy]]

item.title: Nullity Text
item.description: See [[The Grand Nothing]]

item.title: Obliteration
item.description: See [[Damnation]].

item.title: Oblivion
item.description: What remains of the Great Old One, [[Goh’zul]]. The last remaining fragment of the being in which [[Zol]] resides, manifesting as one of its [[Planes]]

item.title: Obscuran
item.description: And from the Sea of Monsters rose many beings. Creatures of stone, and creatures of feathers. Beings of light, glass, and fire.

item.title: Observum
item.description: [[The University]]’s institution regarding the study of [[Gods]], their power channeled through the will of [[Observance]], and their relationship to [[Zol]].

item.title: Off-Human
item.description: The concept of ‘[[Off-Human]]’ is a portion of the [[Great Magic]] belief. It was spawned due to the publication of [[The Old World of Zol - Excerpts from The Grand Nothing]], and long standing cultural divides from the early [[First Age]].

item.title: Ohlit
item.description: Zolaen God of The Sea, Major Deity ![[Ohlit.png]] Ohlit, the great spirit of the sea. One of the most magnificent of the [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: Old Zol
item.description: The highly advanced civilization of [[Zol]] that existed in [[The Before]]. It was entirely lost in [[The Undoing]].

item.title: Orcs
item.description: Might and Wisdom ![[Orc.png]] Description The history of [[Orcs]] paint a picture of fearsome strength, and wise philosophies. Their culture was at the epicenter of the [[Alderian Rebellion]].

item.title: Orella Bard College
item.description: The prestigious [[Holocene]] school of art. Only accessible to those of great means, or who have found themselves in the favor of a wealthy patron.

item.title: Outer Villages
item.description: An outer village is a small satellite community that is under the jurisdiction of a nearby city. Their population is typically a few hundred people, and rarely exceeds two thousand.

item.title: Owlin
item.description: Wise and Perceptive ![[Owlin.png]] Description Frequently mistaken for [[Aarakocra]], [[Owlin]] are owl like beings. They are physiologically distinct from [[Aarakocra]], as they bear different beaks, talons, and neck musculature which allows them to rotate their heads 180 degrees.

item.title: Pale Lift
item.description: A Lift that is actively being constructed between [[Holocene]] and [[The Grand Nothing]]. It aims to be a great improvement to [[Gilligan’s Lift]], however its construction has been constantly stalled due to political reasons.

item.title: Persanius
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Compassion ![[Persanius.png]] In one’s creation, we see a whole world that exists only within them. A world worth protecting.

item.title: Pheridian
item.description: Ensharden Nedrahsne ![[Pheridian.png]] Overview [[Pheridian]] belief is often defined by some as an [[Obscuran]] religion. While true by some definitions, [[Pheridian]] belief is one of the larges religious denominations that is not a Zolaen-Centric, or Trinity-Centric belief system.

item.title: Pirates
item.description: Those who ascribe to the lawless nature of the seas. Most commonly associated with [[The Isles of Al’Kehtal]].

item.title: Planes
item.description: [[Zol]] itself is a parent realm. A plane which contains many other planes all anchored to a [[Prime Material Plane]]. The sheer number of planes in [[Zol]] is not known.

item.title: Plasmoid
item.description: Those of Unbound Form ![[Plasmoid.png]] Description No one knows exactly what [[Plasmoid]] are, and they very well may be multiple types of creatures grouped together based on similar characteristics, and lack of information about them.

item.title: Pneumoactives
item.description: Similar to a psychoactive, [[Pneumoactives]] alter/expand the spirit or soul.

item.title: Prime Material Plane
item.description: The Heart of Zol’s [[Planes]] At the center of [[Zol]] exists the [[Prime Material Plane]], also known as [[The Prime]]. It is a realm that all other planes are anchored to.

item.title: Pure Form
item.description: see [[The Glassius Reach]]

item.title: Races
item.description: Within [[Zol]] there are many different casts of people. History, prejudice and culture paints a reputation for each and every race.

item.title: Ralatas, Prince of Beasts
item.description: Wayward God of Beasts and the Hunt, Major Deity ![[Ralatas prince of beasts.png]] Lord of the forest, god of claw and fang, master of the hunt.

item.title: Rello Arr
item.description: A [[Kapesh]] city destroyed in the peak of the [[Triumvirate Battles]]. Its ruins are still overrun by monsters to this day.

item.title: Rift Iron
item.description: A rare metal only found in the rifts near [[Tenzentak]]. It appears in veins similar to normal iron, however after it is mined, it grows back slowly.

item.title: Rift Lung
item.description: See [[Rift Smog]]

item.title: Rift Smog
item.description: A toxic off-gas produced by the regrowth of [[Rift Iron]]. Its effects are a slow, and painful degradation of the body.

item.title: Rockfire
item.description: The Volcanic City, Home to the Fire God [[Daetro]] ![[Rockfire skyline.png]] No city of [[The Three Corners]] is known to house one of the [[Gods]], save for [[Rockfire]].

item.title: Sand Cows
item.description: Massive hairy cows who eat cacti and produce palatable milk which man of [[The Kulpis Desert]] use for hydration. They are huge creatures, 10 times the size of normal cows.

item.title: Sea of Monsters
item.description: The remnants of [[Goh’zul]]’s body, endlessly feasted upon by beings who traversed the cosmos to feed on his infinite body.

item.title: Second Age
item.description: see [[Historical Timeline]]

item.title: Shades
item.description: Those altered by the strange magic of The [[Fell]] ![[shade.png]] Description Shades are thought to be the descendants of those who have spent many generations in the [[Fell]].

item.title: Shardcallers
item.description: The highest ruling power of [[The Glassius Reach]]. One Shardcaller exists for each city, and one city exists for each of [[The Oldshards]].

item.title: Skimmers
item.description: High speed [[Apparatum]] ![[skimmer.png]] Skimmers are dangerous, but wickedly fast vehicles made by way of [[Iron Light]]. Similar to [[Airships]], these vehicles travel through the air.

item.title: Skyferry
item.description: A small cast of large [[Airships]] utilized for travel between [[Heliodor]] and [[Elysium Station]]. Some are very luxurious to transport nobility, while others are very utilitarian to transport workers.

item.title: Skytrack
item.description: A cable car system which moves passengers from the docks to the upper city in [[Zessgorn]]. Functions using [[Iron Light]].

item.title: Slavery
item.description: The heinous act of forced labor, and stolen freedom. A terrible product of the vast power differences that exist in [[Zol]] !

item.title: Speakers
item.description: Those who know at least a small portion of [[The Old Tongue]]. These individuals are revered across [[Zol]] as the peak of the magical arts.

item.title: Speciatum Magica
item.description: [[Speciatum Magica]] is the Human translation of Speciation by Magic The term [[Speciatum Magica]] is used to describe a race of beings who was brought into existence after [[The Undoing]] by some product of [[Magic]].

item.title: Stormblessed
item.description: Individuals who garnered the favor of [[Adrathar, Father of the Wind]] during their trials of [[The Enduring]]. It is not known exactly what specific actions allow for an individual to become [[Stormblessed]], but those who have experienced it claim to have accomplished a feat of courage, strength, will power, wisdom, or something of the sort.

item.title: Stormcallers
item.description: A profession within [[The Ward]] where individuals act as naval scouts that send word back to the cities when signs of a storm are spotted.

item.title: Stormdew
item.description: See [[The Ward]]

item.title: Stormwall
item.description: ![[Stormwall.png]] The threshold between the [[Greatwinds]], and the cities of Three Corners who could not weather the storms. [[Stormwall]] is a naturally occurring barrier that cuts [[The Ward]] of almost entirely from the rest of [[Zol]].

item.title: Sworn Wanderers
item.description: Those who devoutly follow [[The Wandering Gods]]

item.title: Sylfs
item.description: See [[The Elemental Planes]]

item.title: Tabaxi
item.description: Feline Physiology ![[Tabaxi.png]] Description [[Tabaxi]] are cat-like beings who have many of the same physical advantages as cats, and are also known to bear many of the same personality traits as well.

item.title: Tarot Cards
item.description: See [[The Tarot]]

item.title: Tarot Ring Bearers
item.description: Those who posses one or many of [[The Rings of Tarot]].

item.title: Teleportation Circles
item.description: The most efficient, and expensive form of travel. [[Teleportation Circles]] are magical constructions utilized by Casters as a both a destination and origin for their teleportations.

item.title: Tellab, the Wise
item.description: Zolaen God of Wisdom, Major Deity ![[Tellab The Wise.png]] He who understands all and seeks for others to do the same.

item.title: Thanks
item.description: [[Zol]] took quite a lot of time and effort for me to build, and it wouldn’t have been possible without the help, and inspiration from a lot of people in my life.

item.title: The Acrylons
item.description: See [[Jerda’ll]]

item.title: The Ancestor
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Origin ![[The Ancestor.png]] To understand one’s place in the world one must first understand where they have come from, and why.

item.title: The Anger of the Stars
item.description: A strange phenomenon that some fringe academics, and occultists devote much, if not all of their lives to. It is said to be a magical influence that radiates from the cosmos.

item.title: The Anti-Trinity
item.description: A power often referred to in Trinity-Centric and Zolaen Centric [[Religion]]s. This power is not recognized by academics, but many believe in its existence.

item.title: The Apex
item.description: See [[The Oldshards]]

item.title: The Archives
item.description: See [[The Kybis Assembly]]

item.title: The Arendari
item.description: See [[Hoss]]

item.title: The Auroran Summits
item.description: ![[The Auroran Summits.png]] One of the smaller mountain ranges within [[The Three Corners]], but its size does not detract from its majesty.

item.title: The Awakening
item.description: A term used for the recorded explanations by the earliest people who were transported to [[The Three Corners of Civilization]] and had their memories taken during [[The Undoing]].

item.title: The Badlands
item.description: See [[The Taming of the Badlands]]

item.title: The Before
item.description: The lost ages of [[Zol]]. An epoch of unknown duration that occurred between the [[Origin]] and [[The Awakening]]. The age came to an end on the advent of [[The Undoing]].

item.title: The Blades
item.description: ![[The Blades.png]] A haunting range of sharp peaked mountains, slanted steeply with their peaks pointed at the north east. This mountain range is a culmination of the strange places it borders upon.

item.title: The Bloodshed Presence
item.description: Void God of War, Minor Deity ![[The Bloodshed Presence.png]] The rush of battle, the heat of the moment, the thrill of taking a man’s life.

item.title: The Brass Hall
item.description: The central hub of [[The University]], and famed school of mages and [[Artificers]] ![[The Brass Hall.png]] Located within [[Brass Taldora]], [[The Brass Hall]] is the most prestigious education institution of the west.

item.title: The Castle of Bodies
item.description: Void God of Wrath and Madness, Major Deity ![[The Castle of Bodies.png]] The product of desperation, a horrible result of an attempt to combat [[Goh’zul]] gone wrong.

item.title: The Circle
item.description: Spoken of in Trinity-Centric and Zolaen-Centric [[Religion]], [[The Circle]] is said to be the source which gave [[Goh’zul]], the cosmic entity which [[Zol]] resides in, his power.

item.title: The Cliffs of Aeordel
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence A peak with no base. A cliffside so high it overlooks all of [[Zol]].

item.title: The Code
item.description: See [[The Isles of Al’Kehtal]]

item.title: The Coilwalker
item.description: Wayward God of Life and Death, Major Deity ![[The coil walker.png]] First of the dead, he who is master of [[The Mortal Coil]], the one who gifts a vessel a soul at birth, and guides it to its resting place after death.

item.title: The College of Hoss
item.description: A school of magic on the edge of the world. [[The College of Hoss]] is remote, and located within a city of its own rule, [[Hoss]].

item.title: The Conservatory
item.description: Of Life and Knowledge ![[The Conservatory.png]] [[The Conservatory]] is the sole institution under [[The University]] focused on the understanding of [[Viridescence]] and its relationship to [[Zol]].

item.title: The Cosmos
item.description: Beyond the [[Planes]] of [[Zol]] Reality itself. [[The Cosmos]] is the endless expanse of many magics, gods, and worlds alien to [[Zol]].

item.title: The Coven
item.description: Once a unmatched, unified coven of 14 powerful witches. Now fractured into two rival groups. The remaining 9 of [[The Coven]], and the 4 traitors of [[The Cult of the Mothers]].

item.title: The Crown Titans
item.description: The legion of elite and magical fighters under the control of The Crux, [[King Galliard]]. ![[Title Splash.png]] Crown Titans are individuals given a one of 5 unique powers by The Crux.

item.title: The Cult of the Mothers
item.description: A dangerous and mysterious cult of the witches who betrayed [[The Coven]]. These individuals seek greater power that the balance of [[The Coven]] could not given them.

item.title: The Dangers of the Wilderness
item.description: [[Zol]]’s wilderness is remarkably dangerous. Threats like beasts, monsters, and criminals make life outside of civilization very deadly for the average person.

item.title: The Dragon War
item.description: The people of [[Zol]] had little time to situate themselves after [[The Undoing]] before the first of their great challenges began.

item.title: The East Mounts
item.description: ![[The Eastmounts.png]] The cursed mountains of east [[Laenwalde]]. Feared by the elves of [[Gethsemane]], and rarely traversed by explorers. These otherwise unassuming peaks are thought to hold a great evil.

item.title: The Edgeless Nature of Zol
item.description: At the edges of [[Zol]]’s maps lies the unknown. Those who venture beyond these edges of the explored world do not often return.

item.title: The Edinokai
item.description: The Saen School of Swords. Located within [[Kosskazoka]], [[The Edinokai]] is a school of fearsome martial fighters trained in the way of traditional weaponry.

item.title: The Eelynn
item.description: The schools of [[The Oldshards]]. The academic institution of the [[Changelings]] within [[The Glassius Reach]]. There are two instances of [[The Eelynn]].

item.title: The Elemental Planes
item.description: A unique group of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Academics are unsure of exactly what forces form the [[Prime Material Plane]], but many theorize it was constructed by overlapping 4 basic elemental [[Planes]] that, when combined, make the complex [[Prime Material Plane]].

item.title: The Elven-Dwarven Concord
item.description: The Elven-Dwarven Concord [[Gethsemane]] was a place of high tension between the [[Elves]] and [[Dwarves]]. Their differences never sparked a true conflict but there was always an air of distrust between the two cultures.

item.title: The Enduring
item.description: A trial sought by young, brave viking warriors. See [[The Ward]] for more information.

item.title: The Ethereal Plane
item.description: The cognitive plane that overlays all [[Planes]] of [[Zol]] The Ethereal, the Realm of Cognition, the Plane of the Soul. [[The Ethereal Plane]] is a frequency of existence that acts almost like a true plane of its own.

item.title: The Fetterpeak Mountains
item.description: ![[fetterpeak.png]] [[The Fetterpeak Mountains]] are the most explored mountains in all of [[The Three Corners]]. This region is located between [[Kapesh]] and [[The Free Cities of Alderun]], bookended on either side by [[Archaic]] and , the magical cities of their respective kingdoms [[Deepspell]].

item.title: The First Bastion
item.description: My Sword for [[The Watcher]] ![[The First Bastion.png]] [[The First Bastion]] is technically an institution of [[The University]] as part of the [[Observum]].

item.title: The Forgotten Heavens
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Home to [[The Night Empress]], [[The Forgotten Heavens]] is a landscape of old overgrown ruins and a sky full of shooting stars.

item.title: The Golden Council
item.description: see [[The Taming of the Badlands]], or [[Heliodor]]

item.title: The Great Wall of Roots
item.description: The barrier that exists between [[Zol]] and [[The Cosmos]]. It is a nexus of strange, golden, semi-transparent, root like plants. The roots themselves appear as dead, however they are extremely durable.

item.title: The Hailent Tree
item.description: See [[Laelanor]] and [[Gethsemane]]

item.title: The Hatiat
item.description: [[The Hatiat]] are a well known nomadic culture within [[The Three Corners of Civilization]]. Diverse groups of closely knit individuals travelling from city to city via long convoys of caravans.

item.title: The Hooded Presence
item.description: Wayward God of Shadows, Minor Deity ![[The hooded presence.png]] The [[Fell]] god of deception, espionage, and trickery. [[The Hooded Presence]] is the embodiment of shadows themselves.

item.title: The Hum
item.description: See [[Holyfield]]

item.title: The Illithid Invasion
item.description: The first ever recorded incursion of [[Zol]] from a force beyond [[The Great Wall of Roots]]. In the middle of the [[First Age]], [[Illithids]] invaded [[Zol]] suddenly and with a great initial force.

item.title: The Immortal Ocean
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence The Skyless Sea. [[The Immortal Ocean]] is the vast and beautiful home to. [[Ohlit]] and his children, [[Ellyon and Aradon]].

item.title: The Iron Father
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Dedication ![[The Iron Father.png]] He who rebirths in flame and song. [[The Iron Father]], also known as Grimnore, is a one of [[The Wandering Gods]].

item.title: The Iron Tracks
item.description: What unites us ![[The Great Tracks.png]] Construction The Great Iron Tracks are a wonderous feat of engineering. Designed by the combined efforts of [[The University]], [[Kerketh Academy]] and [[The Kybis Assembly]].

item.title: The Isles of Al'Kehtal
item.description: The Island City of Pirates ![[Isles of Al Kehtal.png]] Built from the remains of ships torn asunder by waves or combat, [[The Isles of Al’Kehtal]] is a haven for the pirates of [[The Three Corners]].

item.title: The Kodoros
item.description: ![[The Kodoros.png]] A desert mountain range and canyon filled with reptilian beasts, sand worms, bandits, and a strange magical plant called [[Larkleaf]] that is a potent ingredient in [[Alchemy]], and very precious to the people of [[Saen]].

item.title: The Lifeweaver
item.description: Zolaen God of Nature, Major Deity ![[The Lifeweaver.png]] God of everything from stone to flesh. [[The Lifeweaver]] has dominion over all natural things in [[Zol]], and is one of the most powerful [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: The Maul Bearer
item.description: One of [[The Void]]’s powerful [[Demons]]. [[The Maul Bearer]] is one of the most culturally significant [[Demons]] as he played a role in the [[Triumvirate Battles]].

item.title: The Moons
item.description: Three planets amalgamated into Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Hovering in the skies of [[Zol]] are three barren planets floating with one another in a slow orbit.

item.title: The Mortal Coil
item.description: The force that bonds a soul to a vessel, and disjoins them upon death. ![[the mortal coil.png]] [[The Mortal Coil]] is a primal force that exists in [[Zol]], it is what causes things to live and die.

item.title: The Night Empress
item.description: Zolaen God of Night and The Moons, Major Deity ![[nightempress.png]] Known for their mystery and matronly nature, [[The Night Empress]] is the cryptic mother who sits amongst the [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: The North Honor
item.description: A pact formed between the cities of [[The Ward]] during [[The Dragon War]]. Its purpose was to unite the people against their greater foe, the [[Dragons]].

item.title: The Obsidian Temple
item.description: The School of the Gods ![[The Obsidian Temple.png]] Located within the holy city of [[Rockfire]], [[The Obsidian Temple]] is a strange menagerie of many different religious groups all sharing a single roof.

item.title: The Old World of Zol - Excerpts from The Grand Nothing
item.description: A highly controversial text on the archeological discoveries of [[The Grand Nothing]]. Written by Hammond Leduran, Eldon Viconell, and Irid Mathrapp.

item.title: The Oldshards
item.description: [[The Apex]] and [[The Vertex]] ![[the Oldshards.png]] At the start of [[The Awakening]], the [[Changelings]] of [[The Glassius Reach]] found themselves in the possession of two strange relics called [[The Oldshards]].

item.title: The Oodillid
item.description: A long, and slimey creature who is rumored to live beneath [[Kierketholl]]. It is said to be reasonably dangerous, and exceptionally hard to kill.

item.title: The Palace of Drole
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Music and laughter can always be heard echoing down its halls. Smelling of incense and cooking foods, [[The Palace of Drole]] is home to [[Yanneran]].

item.title: The Path
item.description: See [[Laelanor]]

item.title: The Pattern
item.description: See [[The Glassius Reach]].

item.title: The Peaks of Myth'ira
item.description: ![[The Peaks of MythIra.png]] The sacred mountains of the [[Dwarves]], filled with fire and precious [[Mythril]]. These imposing peaks are home to cities, riches, and many [[Dragons]].

item.title: The Prime
item.description: See the [[Prime Material Plane]]

item.title: The Provident Oaks
item.description: See [[Gethsemane]] and [[Laelanor]]

item.title: The Pure Forest
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Boundless, uncorrupted and wild. [[The Pure Forest]] is an infinite forest that spills off of [[The Lifeweaver]]’s form.

item.title: The Ramshorn
item.description: The protectors of [[The North Honor]]. The valiant and brave souls who fend off the threats of [[The Ward]] and guard the cities of [[Often]] and [[Fike]].

item.title: The Ratking
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Unrestraint ![[The Ratking.png]] To fall in line is to betray the beauty of chaos and the gifts of an uncertain fate.

item.title: The Raven Queen
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Wit ![[Raven 2.png]] Sharpness of mind outweighs sharpness of blade. [[The Raven Queen]] carries the moral of Wit.

item.title: The Rebuilding
item.description: An era of [[Zol]] spent in great difficulty. Wilds were tamed, the first cities were built, and the last generation of the old world began to die off.

item.title: The Shroud
item.description: See [[The Shroud of the Void]].

item.title: The Shroud of the Void
item.description: Supreme Void God of Darkness, Major Deity ![[The Shroud of the Void.png]] The Culmination of Darkness, The Consumer, The Great Deceiver, [[The Anti-Trinity]].

item.title: The Space Outside Reality
item.description: An eldritch myth told by alien monsters called [[Illithids]]. Manifesting as one of the [[Planes]] of existence with laws like no other

item.title: The Speakless
item.description: See [[Holyfield]]

item.title: The Storm Horizon
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence The origin of storms. [[The Storm Horizon]] is an expanse of sea, containing a monolith of solid winds at its center called The Stormheart.

item.title: The Sun
item.description: See [[The Elemental Planes]]

item.title: The Taming of the Badlands
item.description: Western [[Zol]] was originally populated with the most diverse set of beings in [[The Awakening]]. The myriad of people and chaos made for a wild expanse with little to no governing forces.

item.title: The Three Corners
item.description: See [[The Three Corners of Civilization]].

item.title: The Three Corners of Civilization
item.description: ![[Zol World Map v1.png]] A land bound by dangerous and impassible wilds, [[The Three Corners of Civilization]] sits on the edge of [[The Grand Nothing]].

item.title: The Undari
item.description: See [[Penthe]] and [[Ryze]]

item.title: The Underdark
item.description: ![[The Underdark.png]] The vast nexus of caves the spans underneath [[Zol]]. No one knows the width and depth to which these caves reach, but it is thought that less than 1% of it has been mapped.

item.title: The University
item.description: Those who seek to understand [[The Wills]], the people of [[The Three Corners]], and how the world can be bettered. [[The University]] was founded upon altruistic motives during the later stages of [[The Taming of the Badlands]].

item.title: The Unknown Realm
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence A plane brought to [[Zol]] by the [[The Wandering Gods]]. A vast forest containing many unique estates, each homed by one of the [[The Wandering Gods]].

item.title: The Vertex
item.description: See [[The Oldshards]]

item.title: The Void
item.description: What remains of the [[Sea of Monsters]], one of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence The horror of [[Zol]]. Home to the evil [[Void Gods]].

item.title: The Wasp Eater
item.description: Void God of Plague, Minor Deity ![[The Wasp Eater.png]] He who culls, King of Plagues, [[The Wasp Eater]] is a hyper intelligent being who claims to seek the fair destruction of life itself.

item.title: The Word of Blades
item.description: Faraday, The Edge of [[The Edinokai]], Bearer of The Word of Blades, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Faraday.png]] The greatest swordsman of [[The Three Corners]].

item.title: The Word of Fire
item.description: Valmore, Hero of Three Fires, Bearer of The Word of Fire, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Valmore.png]] The Guardian of [[Kapesh]], and patriarch of the [[Church of Three Fires]].

item.title: The Word of Growth
item.description: Isil, Guardian of Gethsemane, Bearer of The Word of Growth, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]]* ![[Isil.png]] A druid of unmatched power.

item.title: The Word of Shadow
item.description: The Word of Shadow, Unseen Hero, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]]* ![[Shadow.png]] The Word of shadow is the anonymous [[Wordbearer]]. No one knows their true identity, origin, or place of residence.

item.title: The Word of Wrath
item.description: Jaw, Horror of Galfora, Bearer of The Word of Wrath, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Jaw.png]] Living destruction, the killer of men.

item.title: The Wrath Wastes
item.description: Once a lush and strange forest called Galfora. Technically part of [[Gethsemane]], [[The Wrath Wastes]] are now an dangerous and barren wasteland of sharp jagged stone and grey sand.

item.title: Tieflings
item.description: Demon Blooded ![[Tiefling.png]] Description Much stigma and legend revolves around [[Tieflings]]. Said to be of demonic nature, [[Tieflings]] are both feared and adored for their unique manifestation.

item.title: Trains
item.description: see [[The Iron Tracks]].

item.title: Trinaism
item.description: Body, Soul, and Vizir. From these three things, we are one. ![[Trinian.png]] Overview [[Trinaism]] is a Trinity-Centric denomination of religion within [[The Three Corners of Civilization]].

item.title: Triton
item.description: See [[Tritons]]

item.title: Tritons
item.description: Those of Lake, River, and Sea ![[Triton.png]] Description [[Triton]] come in many shapes and sizes. Some appear very fish-like, while others appear more like humans or elves covered in scales.

item.title: Triumvirate
item.description: See [[The Triumvirate]]

item.title: Triumvirate Battles
item.description: [[The Triumvirate]] nations, [[Kapesh]] and [[Gethsemane]], have a historic reputation for sparring with one another. Separated by [[The Narrow Sea]], these nations warred from roughly annum 2600 to 4000.

item.title: True Form
item.description: see [[The Glassius Reach]]

item.title: Uroga, Hag of the Sea
item.description: Void God of Fathoms, Major Deity ![[uroga.png]] Queen of the deep, the most powerful of the mysterious [[Hags]]. she who commands the horrors that lurk in the depths of the ocean.

item.title: Viridium
item.description: [[The University]]’s institution of nature and its power. The [[Viridium]] studies the will of [[Viridescence]] from an academic perspective. Not only does it seek to understand the wonder and majesty of nature.

item.title: Void Gods
item.description: Fear the depths of Zol, for not even the Gods know what true horrors lurk in its Void The Dark [[Gods]] who lurk deep, deep beneath [[Zol]] in [[The Void]].

item.title: Wanderian
item.description: All who wander ![[Wanderian.png]] Overview [[Wanderian]] belief is the religious denomination of Wanderer-Centric belief. It is a relatively uncommon, and unstructured belief system.

item.title: Warfare
item.description: War within [[Zol]] is a delicate thing. In a place where the scale of physical and magical power is vastly different on either end, warfare can become far too dangerous if not kept in check.

item.title: Warforged
item.description: Of Iron and Light ![[Warforged.png]] Description Spawned from [[Mechanicum Immaculatum]] during the early 4th millennium. Some say [[Warforged]] were discovered, while others say they were created.

item.title: Wayward Gods
item.description: [[Gods]] that are not aligned with [[The Watcher in The Door]], [[The Wandering Gods]], or the [[Void Gods]]. They may be benevolent, wrathful, or have their own personal goals.
